page.title: 02STONE STREET, MAIDSTONE
page.content: Stone Street is the Maidstone end of the Hastings Road running south up the side of the Len Valley from the bottom of Gabriel's Hill. Since the demise of trolleybuses nearly 20 years ago it has been{one-way}southwards. There are no long-term on-street parking spaces although pay-and-display{car parks}can be found nearby. The nature and range of the street's service outlets typify those of a road leading from a main town centre: in North America it would be called an{ {auto-row.}Fairly new car showrooms mix with dilapidated housing converted to retail use. There are many servicing{ {garages}ranging from self-drive hire to exhaust replacement centres. There are also many take-away{hot food {shops,}from fish-and-chips to Tandoori take-away, and six public houses.
